He could barely speak english so he apologized every few seconds, which was cute, and after we ate he made sure we were happy with the food and asked us how he did as a waiter and that he really hopes we come back because we were really nice to him.... awww. :) I gave him a good tip.  Besides that, the food is pretty good. I always have to order that kiwi drink from the kids menu because its just fantastic. hahaha. And to be honest, their pizza isn't all that great in my opinion. And the bread you start off with is bland and lame. Its all about the pasta.... mmmm. Pesto.

The service is fast and the server is very friendly. The food...uh...not so much: * I got the Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage Pizza Neopolitan Style (just add 1.50). It tastes weird at first, but gets better the second bite. After I put on a lot of hot sauce...it lacks something I can't figure out what. And also I should've got it pan style, because I can't really appreciate it when it's thin crusted.  I only ate 2 slices considering that I'm a pizza addict and I'm starving that time. * I also got the Chicken Chowder. Again, it tastes weird at first, but gets better when you get used to it. * My hubby got the Sauteed Salmon in spaghettini. Plain salmon, fried. The noodles isn't that great. The presentation on the plate was good though. * Mango Iced tea...not to brag about.  A bit pricey for some food that doesn't have that "tweak" on it. We'll go here again, maybe...as our last resort.
Not the best not the worst. I consider CPK a fast food place so the food and service is what it is.

Alright, I'll admit it, I am a snob. I can't help it. But because of it, I generally hate chains. They just feel so lazy when there are tons of tastier, cheaper, unique options out there.  But, it was open till 10 and in Burbank it seems, this is a rarity. So here we went. I got the only thing I ever really do here, which is the chicken lettuce wraps and the boy got  what I guess he pretty much always gets, the goat cheese and roasted pepper pizza with bacon. It's the same thing every time at place that is successful because it provides the same thing every time. Uniformity, consistency, and all that other good corporate stuff. Wow, getting bitchy here. Moving on.  Our server was attentive, the food was on our table in no time, and the bill was as expected. I guess it could be worse, it's just that I'd really rather live a life full of bumps than travel steadily along on a flat plane.

This review is for anyone ordering take-out directly or with LA Bite from CPK Burbank. The salad and appetizer portions are oddly proportioned, and I've had a couple of errors with larger orders--meals not arriving, salads arriving without some of their more important toppings, someone requesting sauce on the side and getting every part of their meal in a separate container, and so on. If you're in charge of ordering for office meetings or dinners, I cannot recommend it. Or maybe just order a few pizzas.

CPK used to be better years ago, but they gone the way of fast food and servers to match. The prices, unfortunately, have remained the same which makes it a terrible value. We had quite the doofus of a server on Sunday night. He seemed like he was always in a rush, but the restaurant was not busy. Busy with himself? We ordered water and diet pepsi, but got water and ice tea instead. We asked if we could get the tamale corn ravioli in a bigger portion. It took him 2 minutes to explain that we could pay double or triple for double or triple portions. Of course, we know this. A simple would have been more efficient. Our bread was of low quality and our chicken wings appetizer were the sorriest we have ever seen. Seriously, 4 wimpy almost inedible cold pieces for $5.50? I seriously could buy something better from the supermarket. Our pizza came lukewarm and asked to have it reheated. And to finish it off, after asking for our check, he brought the wrong check. He was constantly throwing things at us. As a server, you must show the game face and even if you are busy, don't let the customers know. It wasn't even busy, this is why his behavior was very odd. I don't know what's up with this place, but CPK shouldn't hire incompetent people like that.

Super great location, super nice staff, super yummy food. Couldn't ask for more, Free parking is down the street next to Chevy's in the garage. You can also stroll to IKEA and burn a few calories when you are done eating afterward! Eat at this CPK if:   You have at least $15/per person to spend; you like a casually classy atmosphere with a super friendly staff; you are on a date or even looking for a place to take the kids (they have a great kid's menu); you are shopping in Burbank and you want killer pizza or salad. Don't eat at CPK if:   You don't have at least an hour to spare (unless you are ordering their take-out); you are on a very slim budget. Hooray for CPK!

Waiter: Would you like chopsticks?  Me: Uh.. it's pizza. Waiter: Haha.. Oh you know. I'm just kidding.  One of the top 10 weirdest encounters I've ever had at a restaurant. Besides suggesting the Asian Chicken Salad and asking me how true to "my people's food" it is.. this was kind of hilarious. It's CPK. Sometimes the pizza is hot.. sometimes they forget to put in your food all together.. sometimes you get out of work late and just want to eat and a waiter thinks he's being funny. I'm pretty sure that wasn't on the corporate list of cheesy jokes to make when serving a patron who looks like they might be Chinese. I didn't want to confuse the poor chap and tell him I was Filipino. He might have asked if that meant I was a Chinese person born in Philadelphia. And well.. you can just imagine his tiny head exploding a little bit.

Are you serious? You call this good pizza?! Well i dont know if we ordered the wrong thing - i assume we didnt because it was the most popular one but it was gross (my boyfriend likes CPK a lot though). I know this is a popular chain restaurant but seriously i dont know why.  I have even tried the oven pizzas from the grocery store and i was also not enthused. The salad i got was good and the service was great but the 3 stars is for the bland so called pizza.

CPK is nothing special to me, but they do have a good buffalo chicken pizza. Service is average and prices are a bit expensive, so this is a good once in a while treat. The red velvet cake for dessert is good, too!
Great service, long wait on weekend but that should be expected the food is so good. No matter what you order from Pizza, Pasta, Sandwiches, Salads, or Soups EVERYTHING is satisfying.

Pizza is EH...usually comes out cold and TAKES FOREVER. Thai Crunch Salad...my favorite thing ever...its so amazing. I almost want to drink the dressing. The rest of the food is blah.  Just get the salad and you will be happy. =) But if you like waiting 840238493 hours for your 6 slice COLD pizza go to CPK in burbank. YUM. X_x

We ordered from here for the office today through LA Bite.  Last time that will ever happen.  Across the board awful.  The best compliment was someone said, "The salad was pretty mediocre". The was the NICEST thing anyone had to say about their respective meals.  I had a chicken sandwich.  The bread tasted awful and the chicken tasted as if it had been sitting under a hot lamp for days.  Not to mention the mustard tasted like it had mixed with detergent.  Avoid at all costs!  Terrible, terrible food.

CPK is so convenient, you honestly can't go wrong. I've eaten here a number of times (like, actually sat down inside the establishment) and it's always been pretty good. But, I'm going to rate this CPK on take out since that's so much more interesting than hearing about the goat cheese and bell pepper pizza I ordered for lunch last week. Take out here is truly a breeze. I never knew this until I walked into the restaurant to pick up some food but, if you ask for them to bring the food to your car, they watch the garage through a video camera until they see a car pull in. (Crazy huh?) If you actually want to walk into the restaurant to pick up your food (and therefore fulfill your five minutes of exercise for the day) instead of having them bring it out to you, parking is easy as there is a parking lot right next door.  They haven't messed up our order here yet (*knocks on wood*) and have been super quick about getting food to me at a timely pace. Plus, they include tons of other stuff along with the orders itself - I love the fact that they include a bag of bread and butter with your order if you want. More food? Awesome!

Amazeballs food, great service, if you're going to BJ's please, run away and go down the street to California Pizza Kitchen, you will thank me.  I've been to CPK's before, and its always been great service and amazing food, but this burbank location tops it, its clean and doesn't have cockroaches like Bjs... As you can tell I'm kind of upset having to leave Bj's because the waiter didn't come to us for 25 minutes, and there was a cockroach hanging out on the floor.... Anyways, we ran as fast as we could to CPK, and didn't regret it.  I always get the garlic alfredo with chicken.. YUM!!!!!!!!!!

CPK is a pizza restaurant where I rarely or never order pizza. I often only go because a friend or family member is craving it. Not to judge all CPKs by our latest server performance, but I did get to mindfully laugh hysterically. Our server never introduced himself and didn't even ask us, "What would you like to order?" He plainly stood beside our table and looked at us and we plainly looked back at him waiting for a response yet nothing. It was like a stalker staring at you waiting for some reaction.  Honestly if you want good pizza, there's everywhere else. Like Z Pizza on Larchmont or Joe Peeps on Magnolia, for the franchise type, I like BJs a lot.  Only thing worth mentioning about CPK is that I once met the original Red Ranger there back when I was in 4th or 5th grade when "The Mighty Morphing Power Rangers" were cool.

Short Version: Really good for corporate pizza. Long Version: Yes, it is a chain and as such is lacking in a soul, but I'll be damned if some of those pizzas aren't tasty. Admit it; they do spin some pretty good ideas for their variations on a classic. Is this place for purists? Absolutely not; they'll run the other way and with good reason. However, this place is good for a lunch and the service is always pleasant and professional.

California Pizza Kitchen is the best New York pizza in California outside of New York. It's way better than Los Angeles pizza in New York that's trying to be California Pizza by trying to pass it itself off as New York pizza when it's clearly more like Chicago pizza trying to be New York pizza. I think this once and for all ends the East Coast/West Coast pizza debate.

this place used to win my business in the pizza department but has recently become a lackluster establishment. the waitstaff is all overworked and looks like they need a good nights rest, the management is out of wack and unwilling to compromise on mistakes made on dishes. truly degraded from a 5-star to a 2-star establishment. the only thing giving them a 2-star is the fantastic host staff and the cooks.

i would say cpk is a solid place to go for pizza. but my experience here was ehh...  our server was gigantic and pretty slow. our table didnt get bread but her other tables did. something about a "new bread policy" where they dont bring it out unless you request it. but it seems strange she didnt offer any or ask if it was our first time there. just a strange experience, i suppose.  overall, its overpriced pizza but try the tostada, greek or classic cheese. 1 is enough to split between 2 people. pepsi served!
Chain restaurant.  Crap food.  Okay but stupid service.  Expensive for the meal value.

LOVE LOVE LOVE CPK!  i could eat here 3 meals a day seven days a week.  the thai crunch salad is a must get. its so good and i get it everytime and never get tired of it.. mmmMMM they also have curbside which is nice because i often like to do at home picnics instead of rest. seating. you just call order ahead.. then park in the designated spot and call & they bring it out.
If CPK is good pizza, then I'm Shaquille O'Neal.  Wait a minute, am I Shaquille O'Neal?  That could explain a lot of things in my life.

i personally feel the pizza here isn't what should be ordered (except the goat cheese pizza with roasted peppers and with applewood smoked bacon), but rather the appetizers and pasta dishes.  if you're looking for healthy but delicious, the singapore shrimp rolls (they're just simply delicious! and good for you!) and the chicken lettuce cups cut it. they are phenomenal, and this isn't even a chinese restaurant! if you're looking for  a heart-stoppingly good, greasy appetizer choice, i recommend the spinach and artichoke dip. even if you don't like either of those, you'll love the dip- it's so creamy, cheesy and perfectly complements the crisp tortilla chips alongside it. for pasta entrees, i recommend the chicken tequila fettucine, which has a latin zing to it. it's super creamy and good, and the lemony and cilantro flavor contrasts makes for a damned good dish. second is the the kungpao spaghetti with shrimp. i'll admit i was skeptical about it at first, but once you get it, the sort of sweet but deliciously spicy sauce will change your mind. the third, less intimidating pasta choice is the fettucine alfredo, but it is important you get it with shrimp and mushroom; otherwise, it's just all right.
got the chicken milanese and the linguine with clams. both were very tasty. linguine with red sauce came with a little bit of heat. =)

I had CPK many times before, at numerous locations. They seem to be everywhere.  This is more of a general review for this chain of restaurant.  I can't rate this restaurant that high since...well, it's pizza. I like pizza just like anyone else, but I would not call them "authentic."  Because they created and pioneered the California Pizza, it's not following any traditions..so there goes the authenticity.  But, it is really, really tasty, and it's good for groups and gatherings.   This restaurant also serves pasta, but it's of a fusion fair and it's quite greasy..unless you really can't eat pizza, I would pass on this. Salads are not bad either,  As for the price, it's not the cheapest.. But I guess if you want to save money, you can get the same pizza for less at supermarkets , they do sell CPK pizza now.

I was here a couple days ago with a group of friends... And I ordered the club sandwich which was to my surprise very small and I also got a Minestrone soup with it which was a big mistake because it tasted very bad and my stomach heart all night from it. I will never ever ever go there again =(
I would recommend this restaurant to friends and family. They have a great menu and the food is delicious, but a bit pricy...

Very Disappointed!!! We've always go to any CPK but tonight was the worst nightmare I had encountered~dunno but they had changed their menu and had removed so many delicious dishes ~like my favorite Lingguini Clams ~so I had opted and ordered the Spaghetti Bollognes with sauteed mushrooms (extra fee's) didn't mind ~when my spaghettie came (spaghetti noodles was not fully cooked , very al dente ) oucchiieee~then the red sauce didn't taste like spaghetti at all (so bland) and the mushrooms was totally rushed to sauteed!!! Disgusted!!! first bite called the waitress ASAP!!!and complained ~~had to re-ordered my new order as I am not pleased with it~tasted like rubber yikes!!!! asked the mgr. why is the menu had changed (she said their trying to see if it works out) huh? works out? or the economy? but least to say this is the last time were visiting the place. Sorry CPK!!! were food connousieurs and we love a little bit of fat~hahahha lol~

CPK... better than Cheesecake Factory or BJ'S restaurant but doesn't top Granville!!! I go here because I am a fan of the small cravings section...whenever i'm in the mood for a small bite with the girls, I go here! off the small cravings the Mediterranean salad is delicious, the hummus and feta cheese with pita bread...also their artichoke hearts are perfectly crispy and the creamy sauce you get to dip them in goes perfect with them!. If you're craving something cheesy I recommend ordering their 5 cheese pizza!!! it's sooooo tasty and now they have wheat flour which is perfect for a tomato basil pizza! THE PEA SOUP is a must have!!!! it tastes home made!!!!! I love it.... this place is great for a quick bite with reasonable sized portions! their outdoor sitting is great  minus the sewage odor that Burbank city should work on... it's not CPKs fault!!! but overall it is the perfect little escape from a long day of shopping instead of having to be stuck eating the malls food court meal!

I don't care! I love CPK! Not just because the pizza is so awesome and filling but my god there are some hot pieces of ass's at this location! I know they just want my money to save up on head shots but please take my number down too!  Asshole. Anyways I was with the lovely Adrienne D for dinner. Place was packed but not insanely packed! Our waiter was friendly but not cute. I wanted to sit in the cute guy section who unfortunately for him was stuck handling kids and their parents. At least I know he's great with kids if we ever get THAT serious. I ordered my usually Hawaiian pizza while Adrienne had the tomato basil. I wanted to try a sangaria but it was some sort of "limey" flavor. Eek! CPK has an amazing spinach artichoke dip might I add. We did not order this because we didn't want to stuff ourselves with dip. They also brought us bread. It was nothing fantastic. I'm sure they got it down the street from Ralph's. No not in the fancy Ralph's bakery but it was probably already wrapped from some other bread company. Ah nicely stale just the way I like it! Between the two of us we rung up a bill of $27. Not too shabby.

CPK is always a safe choice when you're with friends and they happen to be stupid motherfuckers who have the taste buds of three year olds.  Decently priced and never fails to satisfy.  I always wondered where they get their bread.  It's so fucking tasty.  I think once I came with a party of 7 people, and I took all the bread for myself.  At first they wanted to lynch me, but they devised a brilliant plan to get me full so that I couldn't finish my pizza.  But alas, they had no idea about the bottomless pit that is my stomach, so not only did I eat like 4 plates of bread (which was a lot, considering it was suppose to sustain 7 of us), I finished my pizza as well.  And got dessert afterwards.  The final score was Paul: 1, Dumbass friends: 0. I always win.

I sat at the bar and couldn't believe the workers don't wear gloves while making  food.  One guy scratched his ear then continued making the dough, gross!! I'm sure this is a health hazard and code violation. Never again will I go there or to any cpk until they wear gloves.

Typically I love CPK, but there is a new small cravings menu which I unfortunately I decided to try.  I went with the sweet corn ravioli.  Sounded like a great choice, until I was brought to me.  I had to pay six and a half bucks for two ravioli cut in half on a plate the size of a tea cup saucer.  I couldn't believe the ridiculously tiny portion and I was sharing this teeny "appetizer".  No wonder there were no pictures on the menu.  No one would ever order these dishes if you knew what you were going to get.  Don't bother with the ity-bity cravings... stick to the full size fare.

The Cheesecake Factory is a weak substitute to true jambalaya, yet I think the one at California Pizza Kitchen gets closer to the traditional recipe.  I am not much of a tea drinker but got the raspberry tea and my meal was the jambalaya pasta which I loved.  Waitress talked like a cartoon character, with a high pitched but cute voice. She was professional but was kept busy.
Every CPK is exactly the same.  This one is not different at all.  Everything is great, food and service included.

Of course the quality of the food is an important factor in a restaurant, but really what you are paying for is SERVICE. 90% of the time, the service here is fantastic. The food is always good and I have been spoiled rotten by the staff here on more than one occasion. I have seen this restaurant on every kind of day or night they could be open and it was not full of people exactly once. This is one of those few places where I want one of everything on the menu. Mostly, I like to order one thing from each restaurant I go to, but this place has more than one thing I really like. I order the Tequila lime chicken fettucine, the Thai chicken pizza, the original chopped salad with a cup of the tortilla soup. Heavenly! And the desserts are heaven and some of the appetisers are incredible too. The prices make the whole thing a good value, but the service brings me back and back again. They make your order how you want it. The food comes out in a reasonable amount of time. Consistently fresh and delicious. Great management at this restaurant. This HAS to be one of thir best locations. Sugestions: Save most of your pizza for the next day and order the Apple Crism for dessert. It's a nice finish at a reasonable price. Oh, seating tip... ask to be away from the front door. They turn their phone up so LOUD you cannot hear yourself think when it rings, which is approximately every 60 seconds. Also, crowds develop in the waiting area and you have hunry people starting at you while you eat.

I went to CPK because my friend visited from Canada. He heard about cpk but it was his first time in both cpk and Ca Our drink was pitch lemonade. I always think that it is always too sweet.. I can't handle it even if i like it. We ordered Kongpau spagetti(i'm not sure about spell haha) and Santa Fe Pizza which is my favorite! Foods are great as usual but the bread that offer from beginning was little harder. The over all service was just fine..

I want to give CPK more stars, I really do.  But sadly, I don't really like their pizza.  I tried the shrimp scampi pizza, which sounded SOOOOO good, and it was only 'meh' at best - and that's after I added some marinara to it to give it some more flavor.  The pasta isn't too shabby, I tried a few bites of my boy's chick alfredo.  And the potstickers were good, I love when the wonton is thin and delicate.  I've tried two of their salads on different occasions and I love the way they chop the lettuce so fine.  The chopped italian salad is tasty, I really like the dressing they use on it.  I had the cobb salad the last time and I made a mistake by asking for blue cheese dressing.  So it was my fault I didn't like the salad - the dressing just wasn't to my taste (I've gotten very used to the way they do it where I work, with a lemon champagne vinegrette.  It's nice and light).  I'm sure I'll go back as my boy likes the pasta, and if I stick with the italian salad I'll be satisfied.
went over here right after ikea...  really good food! i like the garlic fettuccine pasta with shrimp... i ate it  in under 5 mins. hahaha..  pizza is really great too

went here tonight with my bf it was rly good ! I had the grilled chicken ceaser sandwich on cheese herb bread omg sooo good when it came it was warm mmmmmmm !!!! My bf got the garlic cream  pasta ughh  so good !!!!!!!!!  Only complaint it the portions weren't that big adleast for the pasta it wasn't

Sometimes you just want to know what you're getting and a homogenous corporate chain is the answer.  I happen to like the food for the most part, even if most of it doesn't make any sense, like why a pizza joint serves Asian lettuce wraps.  But it's good stuff.  I especially love the Sicilian pizza.

the waitor that waited our table duplicated my debit card because it did not have a chip and made over $500 in purchases.  Guillermo David was the sever (dark hair, glasses, and terrible Acne) who stole my card. As of now management at the Burbank CPK has taken no action and he is still working so please be careful with your information. Once I provide my bank statements and police report they claim the will terminate him.

CPK food is always good! What was out of the ordinary at this Burbank location was the excellent service. Host opening doors for guests, waters super friendly, etc... Only bad thing is the parking situation. Good luck finding a decent parking sport Fri/Sat nights.

Another week, another visit! The food and service is outstanding as always.  Jamaican Jerk Pizza: A+ Avocado Club Roll: A Chicken Lettuce Wraps:A+ Strawberry Mango Cooler: A Shout out to our server ALIYA! Amazing!!!

CPK gets 4 stars for their Cedar Plank Salmon. I am hooked and now it is the only item I order. Burbank CPK prepares it the best and it is consistent every time. I have tried the same dish in Studio City and Hollywood, it is not as flavorful. Salmon is roasted on a cedar plank. There is a nice thin crust of smoked paprika for a little heat. I squeeze fresh lime over the salmon. Each bite has a bit of sweet white corn, spinach, feta and a piece of moist fish. *drool*

The food, like all CPKs, was actually pretty good. We had an exceptionally rude server that would repeat what we said, as if we were idiots. This went on until she over heard my wife telling me she was going to complain to the manager. food 4/5 service that night 1/5 Hope shes not working there anymore, terrorizing patrons.

I didn't think the service here could get any better but it did! Our server was Kim, she is just amazing at what she does!! Such a great personality.  We tried the chicken dumplings for the first time which were great and then my favourites the jerk chicken and buttercake which never disappoint... we also tried the mojito and blueberry smash which were so delicious and strong, had a nice little kick to em :) Thank you CPK for the outstanding service and the amazing food !

Salted Carmel Pudding with cookie crust and fresh whipped cream? I had to get up from the table and walk away or else I would have ordered another.  It's THAT good. As for the rest, well you always get decent service at CPK and the pizza hasn't changed for years.  They always try to come up with something funky and fresh but I stick with the stuff I KNOW is good- the BBQ Chicken, the fresh mushroom and the margarita.  I feel like their salads aren't as good as they use to be.  I preferred the really chopped up ones and now they are more chunky if that makes sense. Good drinks and appetizers too.  I like the hummus and the flatbreads.  Yeah, CPK, old standby.  But gosh darn, that pudding is the stuff dreams are made of!

I think CPK have mastered the art of pizza! They consistently deliver delicious items. My favorite is the tostada pizza and probably the healthiest of them all too! Prices are reasonable considering the pizza size is so big. My tostada cost me $13 with chicken, but its almost impossible to eat, unless you are my size!  The service is always to notch. Attentive greeters, waiters and waitress' are consistent with their business model. The place is always clean and busy. Which leads me to their only flaw...the unusual wait times. Considering this particular location is next to Ikea, I understand the prospect of wait times, but even when I go to the one in Valencia or Woodland Hills I always encounter the same thing...waiting. Aside from waiting when I'm starving... I will always recommend CPK!

Last night my family and I after the movies decided to go have dinner and we came here to CPK. We ordered our kids mac n cheese with the edamame, well on one of my kids mac n cheese there was a hair in it I'm not one to complain or my husband so we didn't say anything and we paid our bill. We brought home the other mac n cheese because my son only ate a bit he wasn't that hungry, well this morning I reheated the mac n cheese for him and he was eating it and guess what he as well also found a hair in his food :/ never again do I go back to this CPK they need to be more cautious of what they serve one ok it can happen but for also the other plate to have a hair ewww!!!!! Disgusting I hope no other kid got hair in their mac n cheese and CPK I DONT KNOW IF YOU KNOW BUT THERE IS A THING CALLED HAIR NETS AND PLEASE HAVE HAIR CHECKS SO THIS DOESNT HAPPEN AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

They always have the best customer service and workers here. Foods also always great and they have many healthy options, and tasty seasonal dishes. I highly recommend saving a little room for the butter cake dessert (to die for literally). The only thing I don't like about cpk is that they don't have condiments, and personally I love having ranch with my pizzA.

Ever since they took the California Spring Rolls off of their menu, I stopped going to CPK - it was what brought me in.  The other day though I had a hankering fro CPK and decided to go in to have one of their signature dishes that has become somewhat of a comfort dish for me - Tequila Chicken Fettuccine.   Through my not so often visits to CPK, I've noticed that they are quietly bringing changes to the menu - A shift towards seasonal and healthy dishes along with a new drink menu. If you remember, CPK use to hand-toss its pizza dough and that's what made their pizzas great.  Currently, they use a dough press.  It seems like CPK will be hand tossing its dough again and introducing some new pizzas and making pizzas the focus of the restaurant once again.

Below average food. Great service. Chicken Cesar salad was awful I didn't eat it and they didn't comp it either. The pizza eh it was just alright.  Egg roll appetizer was greasy and not very appetizing.
Another awesome time at CPK! Great food, prompt service and a badass bartender, Scott! Thanks for the love! - Dot, Not Tepee.

Maybe my taste bud has really changed in the last 5 years.  I don't remember CPK dishes being super salty!  We ordered the Sicilian Pizza, Kung Pao shrimp spaghetti and Spinach Dip.   All three were just loaded with salt.   It was fun sitting in the bar area and watching the cooks in action.   However the food was overloaded with sodium that we both felt sick after our meal.  CPK, please cut down on your salt!!  I used to be a fan.  Not sure if I'd go back again.
Food is EXCELLENT! Management took care of all our needs and gave us two free starters for coming into this location for the first time with all our office members! Thank you CPK!!!

My girlfriend and I love coming to this place, good food and drinks as well we really have never had any bad service, on our last visit one girl that served up was on training and she did well for first time she was a bit nervous but we joked with her so she could be more at ease lol any way my gf and I shared the mushroom pizza with truffle oil and it was so good! Def getting it again
Went to dinner here it was bomb pizza goooooes  tortilla soup was bomb too. Thx to the homie server Gaurav, great service and fun personality. Will be coming back again.

CPL has a good chef, the salmon on cedar plank was as good as any restaurant that is not a chain. I am alway hesitent to give a chain restaurant 5 stars, but the food was excellent, including the spicach with corn , the halibut and the asparagus.

Went here only once.  Their pizza looks good, but based on recommendation, I had: - Chicken Chimichurri. - Peach Lemonade Both were FANTASTIC.  The Green sauce for the chimichurri is Bomb Dot com.  The dish itself was a bit on the light side, but its ok.  The lemonade was very flavorful as well.  Service was ok.  The guy didn't bother us but then again, we had a very simple order.  I would definitely come back.

IKEA-adjacent for when you are not feeling those meatballs.  Burbank's own CPK can be a nice beginning or end to a shopping day on San Fernando Road, a movie at any of the three AMC movie theaters, or a peek inside Burbank's own mall.  Free parking galore in adjoining parking lots.  That original chopped salad remains a perennial hit.

You can't get anymore corporate than CPK when it comes to pizza!  Their pizzas seem to follow a certain basic recipe and no deviations are allowed.  Don't even think about substitutions; whatever is on the menu, that's what you're getting.  However with that said, CPK seem to draw a huge crowd no matter what time of the day.  I've never been to a CPK where I was seated immediately or not bump elbows with fellow patrons. With its enormous popularity and varieties of different artsy pies, their pizzas are surprisingly just average.  If you're looking for gourmet pizza, this place isn't it.  No doubt that CPK is creative but some pizzas just miss the mark in taste.  I had their "new" roasted artichoke and spinach pizza on honey wheat crust recently and it taste like roasted artichoke and spinach on cardboard.  The crust was dried out and tasteless.  I was totally unimpressed.  If I were going to pick out my favorite, it would be the Thai chicken pizza, which was very flavorful and kind of made you forget that you're eating a pizza. It's really a hit n' miss with CPK.  Some pizzas (basic ones like cheese, pepperoni, veggies) are exceptionally good.  But once you dabble with fancier pizza, that's where it tasted off.  Service is average yet the restaurant is fairly clean for the amount of people that come through the doors.  It's good for large parties and does promote a fun environment. However, CPK doesn't promote the "I just have to come back here" mindset.

I've been here on multiple occasions...a trip recently prompted me to yelp this place...its good...solid food...nice place...kinda busy but what can you do...the staff was a little absent...our wait was borderline ridiculous...i was gonna throw a bitch-fit but decided against it because i had a friend with me... service...not so good... food...solid...standard...some fun pizza choices...don't really stray too far from the pizza...their other food is kinda stardard americana fare...boring and predictable for the most part... overall...okay...would come back but not as a first choice... kind of like that guy that you know likes you that you keep in your back pocket in case your lonely but don't really want to commit to...lol story of my life...

A favorite family stop for dinner!  We visit on weeknights, either on days when I miss the Antelope Valley Line Metrolink and have to meet hubby halfway in Burbank by taking the Ventura Line; or on days that bring hubby and the kiddies toward my work in Los Angeles.  Either way, it's a good in-between point for us, and the staff is always friendly and efficient.  The food is consistently good, the dining room clean and well-lit, parking is easy and plentiful.  Tonight I had the caramelized peach salad with bacon and it was delicious; hubby had the artichoke spinach pizza and enjoyed it.  Kiddies loved their cheese pizzas.  If you like CPK, you'll like this one.
I love this place. They have the best margarita pizza and customer service is great.

What can I say about this place that has not already been said? Like most people who yelped before me.....its not my favorite place. It usually goes something like this: [After getting out of big trip to Ikea] A: I'm starving B: Lets Eat, what do you want? A: Well there is crappy Mexican, Corner Bakery or CPK B: CPK it is!

I love the pizza here... always, always on a thin, crunchy crust.  The spagetti is amazing and the key lime pie is sublime. The Burbank store has good service and you can get a seat fairly quickly. All good :)

CPK is one of the few chain restaurants that I will eat at.  I admit that I am a bit of a food snob though I will eat at a 5 Star restaurant as well as a dive & anywhere in between so long as the food is good.  My favorite here is the  Wild Mushroom Pizza   on Honey Wheat Crust w/ Sun Dried Tomatoes  Cremini, Shiitake, Portobello, White Mushrooms, Fontina, Mozzarella cheeses w/ a wild mushroom walnut pesto, garnished with chopped Italian parsley to which I add a ton of crushed red peppers & enjoy with a glass or 2 of Pinot Grigio. I love this pizza so much that I never order anything else!!! I am quite picky about my pizza, being from Manhattan aka New York & I do give a thumbs up.  There was one manager who was very friendly & made sure that everyone was happy. I didn't see him the last time that I was there. If I knew his name I would give proper credit. I love when they give you the coupons for future visits to save anywhere from 10% to 20% off food only. I've been lucky to receive these on occasion. My only advice for the waitresses/waiters would be to make sure that water glasses are filled. I know that it's a very busy job, having been a waitress for a brief time but please keep the water glass full. I always did! :-) It's not pleasant to keep asking for water or to sit there with an empty glass thirsty.  I almost always tip 20% or more but the last time I was there I left the waitress a 15% tip, which is not like me. She didn't fill our water glasses & only seemed to be around to offer dessert or other items in an obvious attempt to increase her tip. It had the reverse affect as we felt that she did not care otherwise.  Most of my experiences here are positive.  The hosts & hostesses are usually wonderful! The passion fruit mojito is delicious! Before or after, you can go shopping in the mall or to IKEA, have a margarita at Chevy's or see a movie. :-)

Not my go to spot for pizza, but since we were in the area and it was getting late we decided to dine-in. It also didn't hurt that it's been years since I've had cpk, so I definitely wanted to be reminded how good the food is. We had an order of the baja chicken tortilla spring rolls for starters and a jerk chicken pizza for the main course. The appetizer was the best part of the meal, the guacamole it came with was awesome. Unfortunately the pizza was not that great, probably a bad selection on our choice but when we ordered the waitress added "good choice". It was far from it, the actual chicken isn't the problem cause it was seasoned well but the sauce ruined it, just overpoweringly sweet. If I wanted dessert on pizza I would've said so. I would not order it again and I regret not going with my first choice which was either the BBQ chicken pizza or wild mushroom. I like that they use a fairly thin crust so it isn't heavy at all. That would keep me coming back and the fact that there are so many other selections. By the way, Good service, clean atmosphere, and the abundance of parking in the structure is never a bad thing.
Start off with the cherry limeaid(non alcholholic) and finish with the hawaiian bbq and california club pizza. Very tasty and filling~

Our waitress Lana rocked! She came around with fresh drinks for her area often so I never reached and found my glass empty.  The food itself was tasty! My love for lettuce wraps and jamaican jerk chicken pizza was rekindled.  The service itself was speedy; maybe because it was a Saturday morning? Who knows, but I will defintiely be back...

I haven't been to a CPK in over 10 years, so a friend and I decided to have dinner there last night. The menu and prices have expanded quite a bit in the past decade, but overall, everything seems to have remained consistent, from the menu items to service to ambiance. I ordered the asparagus & spinach spaghetti ($10.99) with an addition of shrimp ($4.50). I wasn't expecting many shrimp for that low price, but it was a surprisingly generous portion. I thought the dish tasted really good, though maybe a little too much garlic - next time I'll ask them to limit or omit it. My friend got the Thai Crunch Salad ($12.99), which she said was delicious. Our waiter was friendly and attentive. He kept the refills coming, made sure we didn't want for anything, and he didn't bug us when we chatted for awhile after dinner. Not even one evil eye. But maybe that had more to do with the big tip we had given him. Overall, a nice casual dinner experience.

So I took this girl here on a date, ordered the avocado egg rolls ( amazing ) two adio motherfuckers. great service the ENTIRE meal. enjoyed my pizza while almost falling out of my chair, but the vibes were so good the manager came up & conversanted us for a good 5 minutes. Simply put a great CPK with lovely staff & great area

Parking: Easy.  There are parking structures everywhere in that area. Just avoid weekend evenings or any special events. Food: I had the mushroom ravioli and mixed the sauces. it was delicious.  Mixing the two sauces was recommended by the server and a great idea. Service: Great.  She made lots of recommendations and my drink was never empty.

Me and my friend went here at 8:30pm on a Monday night, and when we walked in there were two parties waiting in front of us. One was a party of 3, the other was a party of 1. At first the hostess was no where to be seen for a few minutes, and when she finally did show up, she didn't even acknowledge us and sat the first party. When she came back, she asked us how many people were in our party, not smile or friendly welcome at all. Then sat the other party in front of us. When we finally got sat it took our server 10 minutes to get our two waters. We also asked for bread which didn't come out until our appetizer came out. And both of the pizzas we ordered were bland. The entire time the server was absent, never asking how anything was, talking to other tables and never checking on us. We had to keep asking other servers for help. I ended up sending back my pizza (Shrimp Scampi Pizza) because there was no flavor (I know, surprise for something that sounded so good) and got the Pepperoni, Sausage, and Mushroom pizza instead. It was better, but honestly, how can you mess up something that simple. The service here is horrible and the food was bland as hell! Especially for a Monday night you would think they would be more attentive on a slower night, but maybe they just don't care about the customers experience. It took us almost 2 hours to get out of there. I'm not going to this CPK again.
This place is good for average prices and average food. If you don't want burgers from a fast food joint and you don't want to spend an arm-n-leg either then you go to CPK.

It's a CPK. Bland, boring, and while it's not expensive, I still feel like I got fleeced. Would it have killed them to throw in a little flavor?  The Ikea across the street has better food. Seriously.

do not like the pizza. do not like the jambalaya. do not like the service. do not understand the hype. jambalaya is too salty. server is cold and a lil rude. pizza is overpriced for how shitty it is. 2 stars because im going to give this place another chance to change my mind.
Great pizza. One thing very  surprising is this place does not have French fries.

Not the best pizza I have ever had...and the service was pretty slow causing the food to be "warm". At the table across from us the waitress spilled 4 glasses of lemonade on the guy in the booth, directly behind him and our table, The manager came over 10 min later to apologies..... BUT still gave him a bill!!! The manager didn't bother to stop to see out table or the other people still wiping up lemonade off their cloths....not looking good for a repeat on my part.
This CPK was notably better than my experience back on Long Island. The service was infinitely better, and for some reason the food was better, too. Very serviceable wine list at reasonable prices.
